snippet.textDisplay: He is playing halo 3, it's just not his time yet.
snippet.textOriginal: He is playing halo 3, it's just not his time yet.

snippet.textDisplay:
The ending to Halo 2 sucked but it wasn't really by choice. There was a lot of issues behind the scenes. A year and a bit before it came out they had to essentially scrap 2 years worth of work and start again and pretty much ran out of time. There's a lot, and I mean A LOT, of cut content for Halo 2 that's been discovered and rebuilt by modders etc.  Some of the original ending planned for Halo 2 was rolled into Halo 3.

Still manages to be an amazing game and my favourite campaign.
snippet.textOriginal:
The ending to Halo 2 sucked but it wasn't really by choice. There was a lot of issues behind the scenes. A year and a bit before it came out they had to essentially scrap 2 years worth of work and start again and pretty much ran out of time. There's a lot, and I mean A LOT, of cut content for Halo 2 that's been discovered and rebuilt by modders etc.  Some of the original ending planned for Halo 2 was rolled into Halo 3.

Still manages to be an amazing game and my favourite campaign.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not sure if anyone in your chat mentioned it after you beat Halo 2, but development was a mess. It barely came out at all. To meet deadlines they cut a lot of content last minute and under the hood the code was barely working held together by duct tape basically, yet still regardless the multiplayer was just that good despite everything.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not sure if anyone in your chat mentioned it after you beat Halo 2, but development was a mess. It barely came out at all. To meet deadlines they cut a lot of content last minute and under the hood the code was barely working held together by duct tape basically, yet still regardless the multiplayer was just that good despite everything.

snippet.textDisplay: The Halo 2 end boss (Tartarus) is supposed to be you damage him while his shield is down, then when his shield is up you avoid his hits and kill adds, then Johnson will shoot him with the beam rifle to take down the shields again to restart the cycle til he's dead.  It being Normal difficulty may have made the health low enough that the pattern wasn't clear.  It's not a well liked fight either way though.  Boss fights like that aren't too common in the series, and most of them aren't well liked in general.  The boss fights where it's the groups of enemies in a cool set piece are the ones people like.
snippet.textOriginal: The Halo 2 end boss (Tartarus) is supposed to be you damage him while his shield is down, then when his shield is up you avoid his hits and kill adds, then Johnson will shoot him with the beam rifle to take down the shields again to restart the cycle til he's dead.  It being Normal difficulty may have made the health low enough that the pattern wasn't clear.  It's not a well liked fight either way though.  Boss fights like that aren't too common in the series, and most of them aren't well liked in general.  The boss fights where it's the groups of enemies in a cool set piece are the ones people like.

snippet.textDisplay:
6:08:50 I'll be honest, even back when the game came out I found it fairly boring. The Elites that were fun to fight and were replaced with Brutes that were boring to fight. Most of the guns were watered down to be more balanced and were no longer interesting (look at the AR). The story was no where near as interesting as Halo 2. The music was mostly rehashed from the previous two games. 

Halo 3's campaign lost much of what made the first two games unique. It felt like the majority of the creativity went into the multiplayer, which was fantastic.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: I remember being so mad about that cliff hanger ending when I was young. Took 3 years to see the conclusion! The fantastic multiplayer that was online for the first time took the sting away.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember being so mad about that cliff hanger ending when I was young. Took 3 years to see the conclusion! The fantastic multiplayer that was online for the first time took the sting away.

Ah man Iâ€™m sorry the back seaters are getting to you. I also had a different experience since I was a kid and though I didnâ€™t play multiplayer Halo 2 scales difficulty for playing co-op even couch co-op. We also played on legendary and for some reason in halo 2 they decided a single player death should cause a reset to checkpoint rather than requiring both players to die. So the game felt plenty long to me ðŸ˜‚. I didnâ€™t care about the boss fight being short because at the time I felt most boss fights in current fps games felt contrived and janky. So I was glad it was over quickly. (Well quickly ish I remember Johnson taking far longer between sniper shots). 

I think you might really enjoy ODST. Itâ€™s one of the best games in the franchise in my opinion. Even though it is a very different format and mood. Even if you donâ€™t get to it on stream, I would be interested in your thoughts. 

Thereâ€™s also the audio drama promo which is really good. But very few people have listened to it. Many didnâ€™t even play along. I think I threw my official dvd of it out once ripping it which is disappointing because it now sells for like $1KðŸ˜…

snippet.textDisplay: Halo 2s ending is a bit sad cause itâ€™s a cliffhanger but it perfectly sets up 3 so I think itâ€™s fine overall. At the time it definitely would have been more annoying but now that you can instantly go into 3 itâ€™s not a big deal imo.

Man you are so fortunate to live in the UK where you didnâ€™t have to worry about that confrontation with a weird old man in a parking spot turning into a shooting situation.
